title: Interdisciplinary Residential Training Course for Postgraduates in Economic and Social History
abstractText:
The Interdisciplinary Residential Training Course for Postgraduates in Economic and Social History will run annually over two and a half days.

Through a competitive selection process 12 postgraduates in the middle of their research programmes will meet together, and individually with 5 senior members of academic staff in their discipline to discuss the methodological and theoretical challenges in their projects and to identify new techniques to resolve them.

The course fills an urgent need for mid-level and advanced training in this field, given that advanced, high level and focused training and development in economic and social history is only available in two or three institutions in the UK. As the current global crisis has demonstrated, there is a clear need and demand for longer term institutional approaches to current and future economic and social challenges that makes research in economic and social particularly valuable, so the course will also provide subject specific training in employability and maximising the economic and policy impact of research.
